columns.text: In this exercise, we are asked to identify the pros and cons of international sales and the additional risks the company will face.
In the minicase, S&S  wanted to sell their planes in Europe. We are asked to determine the pros and cons of the international sales.

## a. Pros of International Sales

### Increase in sales

With the company selling planes in the other country, the sales will also increase making it beneficial for the company.

### Currency exchange rate

The company may gain profit if more euros are required to purchase dollars. Hence, they will have a profit since more dollars are to obtain when exchanging the sales in euros.

### Reputation of the company

If the company will have a successful market in Europe, it will be heard by other countries and will help increase sales as well. As a result, the reputation of the company will increase.

### Risk Management

The **risk management** of the company will be better.  As there are more risks created when they will sell internationally, the company can make this an opportunity to have a better risk management to prevent the risks created.

### Product may last longer

As they will sell internationally, the product may be popular in Europe. In case its sales will decrease in the domestic market, the product will still be successful in the international market. Hence, the life of the product will last longer.

## b. Cons of International Sales

### Additional expenses

Additional expenses will incur if the company will sell internationally such as tariffs, customs and duties, and international shipping fees.

### Cultural difference

The culture of the country of the company is different from Europe. Hence, they must take into consideration the culture of Europe in order to have a smooth flow of sales.

### Intellectual property theft

Since the company is going to sell its product internationally, there are some that might try to copy the product if they see that it is successful.

## c. Additional Risks


Since they are going to sell internationally, **legal risk** will be incurred by the company. It is a risk from the failure to company on the requirements of the place they will sell the product, which in this exercise, Europe. Another is the **foreign exchange risk**. It will be an advantage if more euros are required to buy dollar. However, it will be a risk if lesser euros are required to buy dollar which may lead to loss on sale.
 

The company must have a better risk management since there are additional risks that will be incurred if they will sell internationally.
As a result, we have identified the pros and cons of international sales and the additional risks the company will face.
